Can you believe we’re already halfway through the year? Hope it’s been a good one so far!
We’ve been busy working on updates to make everyday service work feel lighter. Less clicking around. Faster responses. Better visibility across the board.
But before we dive in, we’ve got something special to share.
We’ve just launched our Wall of AI Champions — a spotlight on visionary CIOs who are leading the way in using AI to transform IT. Driving innovation, experimenting boldly, and making AI work inside real IT ops isn’t easy and we’re proud to celebrate those making it happen.
See the champions →
Want to see what’s new in Atomicwork in action? Join our webinar!
Join our upcoming webinar with Bob, our Implementation Specialist, for a walkthrough of the latest updates and how to put them to work. Live demos, real examples, and all your questions answered - register here!
Resolve faster with Agent Assist
Imagine having a second set of (AI-powered) eyes on every ticket. Agent Assist helps you make sense of requests quickly by pulling together summaries, past issues, asset context, and recommended next steps — all in one place, no digging required.
Laptop acting up? It will identify the issue, find similar requests, and recommend the fix that worked last time.
Find anything quickly and triage with tags
Search got a boost — smarter ranking, keyboard-friendly navigation, and one place to scan across requests, incidents, assets, and more. Tags let you label requests by urgency, topic, or team to filter and act fast.
Workflows that are (JS)ON point
Workflows now support complex data like arrays and nested fields in JSON — so you can act on structured API responses without middleware. Build smarter, more flexible workflows that adapt to real-world complexity.
Track and improve team performance
Track key metrics like SLA hit rate, FCR%, resolution time, and others — per person and per team. You can use this to rebalance workloads, recognize top performers, or surface coaching opportunities.
And that's just a sneak peek at everything we worked on last month. Read our blog post for all the details and updates.
I'd love to know what you think about these features. Please do try them out and share your thoughts in a reply.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Best,
Riya Sebastian
Product Marketing
